etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in John Mason Good (1764–1827), physician and surgeon. From post-classical Latin poliosis from ancient Greek πολιός grey (related to πελιός dark bluish grey) + post-classical Latin -osis

definitions: Partial or general greyness or whiteness of the hair, especially if premature; specifically the presence of a circumscribed area of white hair in the scalp (a white forelock).
